alert.note: Alert for Northern Erie; Southern Erie (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 6:09PM EDT by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm with very heavy rainfall will impact portions of northeastern Erie County through 715 PM EDT... At 607 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm with torrential rain with greatly reduced visibility over Marilla, or 7 miles east of Lancaster, moving northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rains could cause flooding. Locations impacted include... Cheektowaga, Clarence, Depew, Lancaster, East Aurora, Elma, Marilla, Alden, Wales Center, Elma Center, Billington Heights and Clarence Center. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
